metadata.title: CVE-2023-31085 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/mtd/ubi/cdev.c in the Linux kernel 6.2.There is a divide-by-zero error in do_div(sz,mtd->erasesize), usedindirectly by ctrl_cdev_ioctl, when mtd->erasesize is 0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-aws - 4.4.0-1125.131
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-azure - 4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.131').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1').
